values:
Lucky bastard. You're CATcrazy: you can do pretty
much anything you like, everyone still loves
you.

Fucked up, any?
brought to you by Quizilla

Livejournal sucks. And that's all I have to say about that. I have pictures from the Bata Implosion uploadingd even as we speak. Let's see. What I *HAD* posted before it decided to get all weird on me and delete: I did not pass the EMT-I 1st exam, but it's alright because I'm only 20 and have plenty of time to do it. I'm still waiting to hear from the city on about the next stage of the application process....I'm not giving up but I don't have much hope. And I'm presently working on a Rescue Stand-By team in Sparrows Point at the Bethlehem Steel Plant. It's fun. AAANNNNDDD.....I got a digital camera. *wide ass grin* Alright. Here are the pictures from Bata. I'll talk to you guys later. Oh yeah, and here are the pictures from the eclipse that night. -Ray

I'm. Am. So. Tired.

And let me tell you, it's not going to get any better.  *grins*  But it's alright, cause I don't mind.  Hopefully everything will go as planned and by April 2nd, I'll be a medic.  *prays*  If I can make it past this first exam(which is this saturday), I'll be happy.  I'm really worried about the drugs.  There are about 20, which isn't too bad. The only thing is that I have to know every little thing about all 20.  *determined face*  I can do it.  I'm Ray.  

Work is kicking me in the ass.  They keep asking me to pull a 14 hour shift, work two 4 hours classes right after that, get 2 hours off, and work another 14 hours shift.  That's all well and good, and doable, but I'm gettin' pretty tired.  :)  And on top of that I have to study.  Study study study.  Which is what I should be doing now....but I have to have some form of me time, right?  

OOOOOOHHHHHH!!!!!  I know what I didn't tell you that has me V-E-R-Y excited!  I got a letter from the city....they want an interview!  Which means I passed the exam and the physica agility test!  *Does a serious happy dance*

*glances out the window at the guys pushing a truck down the street*  Hmmmm.....that's, odd.  

Anyway.  I'm really happy.  :D

*glances out the window again*  I think I'm gonna go help them...talk to you later.

*screams*  WHY IS IT THAT FILLING OUT PAPERWORK IS SO FUCKING HARD FOR SOME PEOPLE?  All you have to do is make sure if you were here, that you have SB next to your name, if you went on a piece of equipment, you have that number next to your name, and if your the officer on the call, that the DAMN report was filled out! Tell me what good having a 95 response form is going to do when I don't have anything else on that call????!!!!

And here you go, what's so hard about putting the call type on the form?  All I want filled out is what date and the call was.  Maybe the box if you have it....but just put them in the right order!  According to the records, 213 is an automatic alarm when in actuality it was a PI!

*stomps off mumbling about people and their insistence on being stupid*

Sorry it's been a few days. I've been very busy. Between work, EMTI, two firehouses, and home, I've been slightly busy. :D Though, home won't be a factor anymore. We've pretty much unpacked everything now. And neither will two firehouses, because the whole application process will be coming to a close here soon. Anyway, I blither. I've posted a new Memory: 08-14-2004: A night of Caridac Arrests and Fractured Femurs. That night was.....grrrrr...... But that night is over, thankfully. I'll be going to a funeral on wednesday. One of harford counties oldest firefighters died the other night. We're having a whole county firehouse ceremony. It's really sad. The rest of the county has been sending in fill-ins during the day to relieve some of the stress on his home company.... But now I must study....so now I must go....talk to you guys later! Edit: 2320 - I was just reading through some of my old entries and boy was I hypocrytical when I was new....*laughs*....I hope I've changed since then...>I think I need to pay attention to make sure I have! *grins*

Yes, the title has nothing to do with anything. Well...to me it does, but that's besides the point. *grin* I've come to the conclusion that I REALLY LOVE my job. *even bigger grin* Not only am I doing what I like to do (though we could get a few more calls in a day, but not too many more), but I'm doing it with people who I like to do it with. They are, how would Mrs. B put it? Grand! :D Hm....I've realized that the guys at Abingdon don't pay much attention to things. :D Well, I knew that, it just kicked in the other day. I was standing in the bay when they decided to go up to this house that they were going to burn to clean it out. The guys look at me and tell me to get my gear. I had to laugh. It was then that I pointed out I was still gearless. They just kinda looked a tme like: 'oh'. It was really funny. And what's up with that song "Break Down Here" by Julie Roberts: Everything I own is in the back in a Hefty bag I'm outta cigarettes and I'm down to my last rag My last rag? She was really needing a rhyme, because that really sucks. It's a really good song, and that line is just totally misplaced. MEEP! DOGGY DROOL! *is pummeled by a Katie* ALright....now that I've just been cleaned VERY thoroughly, *giggles*, I'm going to go....I need to study some more. Ray

Alright.....here's the scoop.  I've been up for about 48 hours and I"m very tired.  However, I don't want to go to sleep now and wake up in the middle of the night and be awake.  So I'm trying to stay up.  It's just not working very well.  I have nothing to do right now and I'm bored out of my mind.  *smiles*  But it's alright.  2 out of 6 isn't bad.  I'll catch back up, don't worry about it.

Hmmmm....I think I'll go shoot some hoops.....or something along those lines.  :)

Yay, Rescue Me is on.  It's a commercial.  Hence why I'm here.  Just wanted to put a few things on here.  I got my letter from the city.  Dunno' if I mentioned it.  I passed part one.  Going on to part two.  I finally got PPM to give me an EMT job.....even more happierness!  My internet is working.  AANNDD....and EMTI is going, but I don't know how well.  The instructor is going very, very fast.  Though, the rest of us are doing alright with staying up with him so far.  I go to work tomorrow night, so I think I'll try to catch up on my reading....though I think I need to study more....

Alright...gotta go.  Things to do and not much time to do them!

Ray

ALright, so we're all moved in. Yay. *twirls finger* It's really a nice place for Justy. Really. Not everything is unpacked yet, but that isn't too big a deal at the moment. My rooms done....but that's about it. *grins* Hmmm....level had it's very own working fire the other morning. I missed everything but the air-unit, seeing as how I now live about 15-20 minutes away. And it was pouring down rain. But I did get to the scene and did some overhaul (which I know everyone bitches about, but I think it's kinda fun *grin*). Got m'self all dirty n'shit! *laughs* Hmmm....EMTI class is going to kil me, I've decided. We're going into week three and I can already tell you that this is going to be a pain in the ass when it comes to memorizing shit. Of course, we are in Anatomy and Physiology. I'm kinda hoping it might get a little easier. *prays to the EMT gods, if there are any* There's this new show on FX called "Rescue Me". So far it's proven to be really good, though there are a bunch of guys around here that don't think it's giving firemen a good name......but if you go into a firehouse that is pretty much what you see and hear. Sometimes the topic of conversation varies and isn't quite so negative about things, but people get the general idea. Anything else? I don't think so....oh yes there is. I got my letter from the city. Happy times! I passed the first part. Now comes the physical agility testing. I go on the 10th for that....*does some oober-praying!*.... Alright, now I think I'm done. ;)

You know what?  I was thinking today.  Probably something I should try to stay away from doing.  It really kinda got me to wondering about something.

R. Adams Cowley was a great, great man.  He did so much for EMS and prehospital care in Maryland.  For those of you who don't know about him....here's a bit of history....

Cowley was a doctor back in the day.  He worked in the old time shock trauma, back when it was only 2 beds and the survival rate was 20%.  He came up with the whole golden hour and platinum ten minute theories.  Said that most people have an hour to receive care and restore a normal blood pressure before they would die.  He ended up proving his theory.  He also was the creator of shock trauma being it's own entity....in it's own building.  We, here in Baltimore, have one of very few 'free-standing' shock trauma centers in the country.  Now patients brought to shock trauma have a higher mortality rate (I think it's somewhere in the 90's, now).  And it's all because of Cowley's theory and testing.

But it got me to thinking.  It's really expensive for physical therapy and continued medical treatment.  And how many of those patients that we 'save' do we actually save?  How many can eventually go back to leading normal lives?  And how many have to depend on constant help for the rest of their lives?  How many were actually *meant* to die, and because of what we're trained to do, live?  Are we screwing with something that we shouldn't be screwing with?

I suppose I'm thinking too much about it.  If it weren't meant to happen, it wouldn't happen, right?  Like I said earlier, I should probably stay away from thinking....*laughs*

Let's just say I started my EMT-I (CRT) class today.  It's going to be fun.....and very time consuming.  Though I think it'll DEFINATELY be worth it.  There are so many reasons to take this class....I'm really excited about it.

Though the amount of books is murder.  *grins*  Alright....so I'm burned and tired....I'll babble at'ya later!

Ray

Hey guys.  I know I haven't really been putting *real* entries in here lately.  Sorry 'bout that.  Let me think about what's happened in the last...erm, yeah.

I *might* be going with a friend to see her plants tomorrow.  I know, it sounds funny.  But she says we get to take kayaks....so that's all good.

We start our EMT-I class this saturday.  I'm actually really excited about it, which I think is fairly odd considering I'm not really an EMS junkie.  *shrugs*  Oh well.  I think this is Bessie's doing.  I can't stand the thought of her being the only ALS provider around....*shudders*

Hmm....what else.  Oh, I've started going through the garage.  I've only gone through about 1/4 and I've already come across more shit.  *shakes head*  This is going to take a while.

Uherm....I've managed to get sun poisoning, which I believe is amazing since I've never been sunburned in my life.  I think it the medication I'm on, it's made me more sensitive to the sun.  But I tell you what, I don't like being sunburned or sun poisoned.  It's painful and I don't feel very well.  It sucks.

Hmmm....what else.  The firehouse has been rearranged.  We have 4 baydoors on fireside, 2 pieces of equipment per door.  Well, one of the doors is broken.  Sooo, we had to rearrange.  We put the 2 pieces of equipment that we use the least in those 2 bays: the air unit, which usually only goes out after everything else has and the brush truck, which is small enough to back up and pull out another bay door.  And now we have 116 where the utility is normally parked.  Our safety queen Lt. is using the museum, which is where 116 is normally, as a classroom for safety camp tomorrow.

I don't really think there is anything else to write about now...soooo, I'm going to go.  G'night.

Baby face don't grow so fast
Make a special wish that will always last
Rub this magic lantern
He will make your dreams come true for you

Ride the rainbow to the other side
Catch a falling star and then take a ride
To the river that sings and the clover that
Brings good luck to you, it's all true


Pink elephants and lemonade, dear Jessie
Hear the laughter running through the love parade
Candy kisses and a sunny day, dear Jessie
See the roses raining on the love parade

If the land of make believe
Is inside your heart it will never leave
There's a golden gate where the fairies all wait
And dancing moons, for you

Close your eyes and you'll be there
Where the mermaids sing as they comb their hair
Like a fountain of gold you can never grow old
Where dreams are made, your love parade

Pink elephants and lemonade, dear Jessie
Hear the laughter running through the love parade
Candy kisses and a sunny day, dear Jessie
See the roses raining on the love parade

Your dreams are made inside the love parade
It's a holiday inside the love parade

On the merry-go-round of lovers and white turtle doves
Leprechauns floating by, this is your lullaby
Sugarplum fingertips kissing your honey lips
Close your eyes sleepy head, is it time for your bed
Never forget what I said, hang on you're already there

Close your eyes and you'll be there
Where the mermaids sing as they comb their hair
Like a fountain of gold you can never grow old
Where dreams are made, your love parade

Pink elephants and lemonade, dear Jessie
Hear the laughter running through the love parade
Candy kisses and a sunny day, dear Jessie
See the roses raining on the love parade

ALright, so all this house hunting is really putting everyone at their wits end. I'm just glad that we finally found a place. Though, I wish it were not in the middle of nowhere. For those of you who *are* familiar with Harford County, we will be moving to the Village of Church Creek....in Riverside. I'm very upset about this. We get to spend the next year living in a place that 9 out of 10 people think of as the gas stop between Aberdeen and Bel Air. Lots of people don't even realize it's a town. At least it's only for a year. I'm not happy about it, though. *sighs* And now I find out about this new catwoman movie....and her outfit is TOTALLY wrong! All wrong. *nods* ALright. I'm done. Talk to you later.

Well, we went to the carnival this fine eve.  It was fun.  Rode most of the rides.  Got my palm read...that was different.  Saw a few friends.  Went down the tall slide about 6,000 times.  *grin*  We had fun.

But now, bed.  I have to be at work early tomorrow morning.








Though, that palm reader really got me to thinking........

Goodness.  I haven't been on here in ages.  I probably shouldn't even be on here now.  I have things I need to get done.  *chuckles*  Midnight and I still have things to do.... *shakes head*

Anyway....life.  has.  really. sucked.  in.  the.  past.  few.  weeks.  And I mean it.  The only silver lining in this whole fiasco called my life is this EMT-I class I'm going to be taking here soon.  I can't wait for that class.  I'm really excited about it.  REEEAAALLLYYY excited.  *grins*

As for the rest of things, they've been circling around the fact that we need another place to live.  In about 10 to 20 days.  The owners of the house we are currently occupying came home and gave us 60 days to get out.  Not much time to find a house to buy or rent that handles 6 to 7 people, also equivilating to 4 rooms.  My parents are really beginning to lose it, and the rest of us are dancing around the idea of being shipped out to Mongolia for living quarters.  It.  Really.  Sucks.

I hate moving around so much.  We lived in Maryland for going on 10 years and we've lived in 5 different places.  I can't stand this moving all the time.  It's almost like clockwork.  Every two years we should just start expecting to look for someplace new.  *sighs*  

Wow.  It's been almost 10 years.  Time flies when your having, erm, whatever you want to call it because it sure hasn't been fun.  It's been....tiresome.   And it's just not getting any better....especially with this added stress.  I still can't believe it's been 10 years.  *sighs again*

Alright....now that I have just relived things I really didn't want to think about, I'm going to go back to doing what I need to get done.  G'night....

You know what's the best way to eat popcorn? Slightly burned and sprinkled with sugar. Yes, I know you can buy kettle corn and get the same effect....but I like putting how much sweet is in my popcorn. Sometimes I don't want a lot, sometimes I want so much that the cavities form just thinking about it. It's hard to type with a Binx on the keyboard....she's giving me the EYES....*melts*.... *giggles* I"m back-reading some of my posts....god was I angry that night....though, I've gotten over it, so all is well. Oh yeah, we got the results from the I test. Mom, Dawn, and I all made it in. And the company is going to buy the $200 or so dollars worth of extra books for the class. *twirls a finger* Yay. *laughs* And as for IV Tech, I still have to get down to the hospital to get my sticks. I should have gone today, I bet it was busy. And tomorrow I'm back to job hunting. I have a few places I am going to go. I didn't quite get to them in time on friday. So hopefully that goes well. *crosses fingers* Let's see, what else? HdG cops are proving themselves to me....not like they really needed to do that in the first place. It was only one cop and he's gone. *smiles* But in the past week the HdG cops have done a few things that they didn't have to do. Very pleased. Very pleased indeed. Let's see, I don't know if I've informed you about the tests. I took the BCoFD test on the 22nd of May. It really was an insult to my intelligence. If *ANYONE* fails that test....*shakes head*....And I take the BCFD test sometime in June. I don't remember what day exactly. I really want to be in the city. I don't know why.... So it looks like we won't be moving to the house across the street. The hurricane did a number on the roof, which we really all knew about anyway, and it's going to take some time and money - neither of which the owner has to spare at the moment - to fix. So mom went to Uncle Frank the other day and hopefully we'll find a place through him. I just hope it's not far from HdG. I love that town. Out of ALL of the places I've EVER lived, HdG is one of my favorites....and I've lived a LOT of places. *sighs* And on that oh-so-happy note, I'm going to bed. It's just about 0200 now, so maybe I'll fall asleep....maybe.

*clears throat* Yes, I'm here. You can continue to not be excited at my arrival. *grins* I was working on the web-site for Level, particularly the picture page. I found this really neat site called ApplePics.com....it, get this, hosts pics. But not only does it host pictures, it does it really well. I looooove it. Here is an example. And as soon as I get access to a quick computer that has CD access....*grumbles towards a certain person who locked the computer again*....I'll put my pictures from the many recent PI Rescues up. I'm very happy about that site. Erm....we went to the Big M tonight. It was fun. Saw the fireworks from the top of the engine. It was extremely cold, though. Alright.....I'm having a hard time breathing and I'm tired. So I'll put something else later. I know this wasn't much, but I wanted to be sure you guys didn't think I'd died or something....not yet anyway. *grin* G'night.

I think the Bin got into a fight.  Her eyelid is all puffy and red.  I'm giving it about two days before I take her to a vet to get checked out.  I pulled a tick off her the other day and it was really tiny.  I don't know much about ticks and their varieties, but I do know deer ticks are very small.  I don't want her getting ill on me.  She could probably use a check up anyway.  

*takes a long moment to love the Bin-x*

God, she's my life.  I don't know what I'd do without her....and I don't know what I'm going to do when she's gone.  I really don't like to think in those terms, but she is an indoor/outdoor kitty.  And their lifespan is a bit shorter than just an indoor kitty.  

She's gonna be 9 this year.  I've had her since 6 weeks, and now she's going to be 9.  Jesus....and she's perfect for me.  She adapts to new surroundings very well.  We've lived in 4 different places in her 9 short years of living.  And she's quickly adjusted to each of them.  Though, this time, I think it's going to be harder.  I hope not.  She had a hard time adjusting when the boys and I changed rooms.  But I think that was more because we still live in the same house and all.  

She is so gorgeous.  I don't care what mom says.  Her tummy is just an added pillow to sleep with at night....more to rub and scratch. *wide ass grin*




ALright...sorry about that.  I just love her so much....she's my baby.  *more grinnage*

Not much happened today.  I called around for various jobs here and there.  Have a few lined up that I want to put applications into.  At the present moment, however, I'm working on putting those pics on the internet so I can put them up here....

So I'll get back to you.

Alright, so happy times.  I went to see Laulena Jaina Renee <*growls cause livejournal doesn't take ALT commands*> today.  We looked through all her old drawings.  And when I say old....I mean OLD!  *grin*

*sings*  Gotta go fishin!

Ah-hem....anyway.  I might wander down into HdG this evening for a little midnight lighting watching down at the pier.  I sat up on the top of the Paradise Rd. hill and watched the lighting weave it's magic in the clouds.  It was awesome how it jumped from cloud to cloud just to touch each other.  How it would dip down, like the end was a ping-pong ball thrown forcefully into the water, and it would bounce back up to the surface of the water, or in this case the clouds.  How one little bolt could cause millions of other bolts to emerge, causing the sky to light up as if one was staring into a city at night from a far away hill top.  It was absolutely magnificent.  I would like to take a camera up there one night and try to catch some of those images.  That would be grand.

O_o  Now I sound like Mrs. B.  That's just GRAND!  *giggles*

*Sings* I can eat them evvvvv-ry day!

Right.  So as I was getting out of my truck tonight, I hear a whistle blowing in the backround.  I turn on my pager and realize it's HdG's.  I found that to be amazing since I can barely hear Aberdeens at times.

I caught a frog tonight.  B-Uddy almost ran it over.  This thing was huge and it was sitting right under his tire.  It would have made quite the mess.  :)

*sings*  And my mom says that's, okay....

Let's see, what else can I mindlessly babble about on here?  Oh I know.  The Bin broke my plate.  The one that comes with the cup about the size of your head.  The cup was Marvins the Martian head and the plate had his shoes all over it.  Anyway, I digress.  Aparently the husband had a piece of chicken on it and Bin was trying to eat it.  It seems that she knocked it off the table and it landed on the edge of one of our wooden chairs and it broke........clean in half.  0_0  Right.  I don't believe it, but husband says that's how it happened.  All I know is that my cup is now plateless, for the time being anyway.

*sings*  I love the fishes cause they're soooo delicious....

Alright.  So I think I'm going to go to bed instead because my spelling is for shit and that's usually a sign to sleep.  I'll sing, erm, babble more later!

*sings*  Gotta go fishin!
*grrrrrrr-OWLS!*  I'm going to be reallllly pissed if that entry was lost.......  *tail flickers, ears lowered, eyes narrowed, a low growl eminating from my chest*

Grrr.  Things are really beginning to tick me off around here.  Like certain people hearing the tail end of conversations and running to her boyfriend about it.  So boyfriend comes and has a 'talk' with me about it.  Like I told him,  it was not her place to do so and it's for reasons like that that people have a hard time liking her.

Next thing that ticks me off.  When someone who is supposed to be an example, and is also a past officer, goes about doing something so completely wrong that it's not even funny.  

When someone does something you feel is wrong, the correct thing to do would be to pull them off to the side and have a little chat with them, correct?  Not to lay into them in front of other members of the company?  Yeah....I figured you were supposed to talk to them in private as well.  

Brief description of what happened....A group of the guys and I went putt putting last night.  Well, when we were done and sitting around talking there was an accident right at the entrance to the putt putt place involving a motorcycle.  We ended up flying one patient to shock trauma.  Well, I was the primary provider on said patient, and he wasn't exactly with it.  So going along with my protocols, I cut off his shirt to get a better view of any possible injuries.  (((He had chest injuries - possible bruised ribs - and sternum road rash)))  Anyway, when the ambulance left I was cleaning up the mess that was made and I grabbed the shirt I cut off and tossed it in the back of the engine.

We get back to the station and one of the guys on the engine calls my name.  He was standing in front of a group of guys who don't particularly like me or some guys from the group I hang out with.  Anyway, he starts asking me if I was the one who put the shirt there.  I told him I was and he starts 'yelling' at me about how he could have gotten blood on his turnout.  I told him I was sorry, I hadnt' thought about it because when I tossed in back there I knew there wasn't any blood.  I hadn't thought to inform them.  *Impish grin*  My mistake.  He told me that there could have been blood and that the next time I should toss the shirt in my own personal truck.  All the while his voice was raised and he was absolutely convinced that he was absolutely correct.

I said nothing to him at the time, I just walked away.  I later went to the chief, who also happens to be related to said individual, and he became quite defensive before sputtering something about having a talk with said member.

There are several reasons why I'm really pissed:  

1.  If I had thrown it in my truck and I *had* missed some blood, where does that put me?  I have no protective clothing on and it puts me at risk for exposing my truck.  

2.  If I had left it where it was, John Q. Public could have gotten ahold of it not knowing any better putting themselves at risk.  

3.  My mistake for throwing it *unprotected* in the back of the engine.  I still would throw it there as opposed to leaving it or putting it in my personal vehicle.  At least the firefighters in the back of the engine had protective clothing on.  

4.  He,  being a firefighter in the back of the engine and not the officer of the call, had no right to be talking to me about it.  It was his job to speak to the officer, who would *then* come to me.  

5.  He had *NO RIGHT* to do it where it was done.  Period.  

6.  Even if he had been the one responsible for talking to me, he was 'reprimanding' me for the wrong reason.

7.  For his lack of concern for my and the publics well being.

8.  For his lack of concern and respect for myself and my feelings.

9.  My chief's lack of concern over the whole thing.

I think number 9 really pissed me off more.  When I went to talk to him, he instantly became defensive.  I don't care who I'm complaining about.  It could be his own mother.  If the person was wrong, then it should be taken care of.  I honestly don't think anything will be done.....if the chief is left to his own devices.  We shall see.  I could be wrong.  But I'm not going ot leave it to chance.

I'm tired of people thinking they can walk all over me.  I'm tired of it.   "Yes, she'll do this.  Yes,  she'll do that.  No, we don't need to please her.  She won't say anything anyway."  Boy will they be surprised when I finally do open my mouth.  

And someone in the higher ups is really beginning to show his true colors.  Unconcerned about intercompany relations, as was shown when he complained about a picture I have of two officers of another company leaning on a piecec of our apparatus.  Thinks it's "Bad for morale(sp)".  That's exactly what he said.  Though, if someone walks in and sees that picture, ,they're going to think: "Hey, good to see that they get along with other companies".  That's what i thought.  New members won't think that we hate each other because we hardly ever drill with them.  The only people who have a problem with that picture are the people who have some form of problem with the people *in* the picture.  *grumbles*

He's unconcerned about keeping certain members happy and doing everything in his power to keep others satisfied.

He babbles about something that looks good to the public, but isn't interested in listening about what actually needs to be put.

It's just a bunch of little things....and I probably shouldn't be babbling about it on here.  But no names were mentioned to protect the innocent and the not-so innocent.

All of that coupled with the move.  Oh yeah, another topic of great joy in my life at the moment.  The move.  Mom comes to me the other night after a call while I was cleaning up and tells me that when we move this august, dad won't be coming with us......again.  He can't live the way we are living.  I find that to be totally irresponsible on his part.  He has a 10 year old son to be thinking about.  When they chose to have children, they chose to put their lives on hold, and they chose to devote their lives to said children.  You don't just walk out on them unless your life is threatened or your actions with the signifigant other will affect the child in any way.  Neither of which has occured this time.  Last time was different....but there is no excuse this time.

God do I need a vacation....

On a happy note, I took the Baltimore County test yesterday afternoon.  And a certain 'Shrek' ditched me.  *smiles and shakes head*  He told me to meet him at the park and ride and we'd go up together - And get this,  he is an officer from another company.  I wonder if the higher up doesn't want me hanging out with *him*, either? - Anyway, I get about 50 phone calls from various and sundried people that morning stating that he wasn't feeling well and that he was going to have to miss it.  I have to bap him one.  *grins*  He really did miss a simple test.  100 questions done in about 1/2 hour.

16.  If an arm is immobilized, it is: 
    a.  Bloody
    b.  Unable to move
    c.  Bent backwards
    d.  Removed from the body

I'm serious, they were all like that.  The only part that was semi difficult were the "Put these in the logical order", and that's only because you had to put them in order and then answer questions about them.  *giggles*

The City's is coming up soon, as well.  That's really where I want to be hired.  I don't know why, but I've always wanted to work in the city.  However, either will do.  I just want to be paid to do this job.  I want to be able to do this all the time and not take time out to go to work, you know?

I do need a job until then, though.  Like I said earlier, I quit HtH.  I also only lasted a day at Crown.  That place was an abomination and I wouldn't wish it on my enemies.  I do have a job at Paramedical Personnel of Maryland.  I'm a BLS instructor.  I teach CPR, First Aid, and Health Care Provider.  I'm not too sure what the Health Care Provider course is yet.  I still have yet to sit in on one.  I can teach the others already, though.

What was supposed to happen was I was supposed to sit through each course once as a student, once as a support instructor, and then I could go out on my own when I was comfortable to do so.  Well,  I got to skip the 'sit in as a student part' because I've been an EMT long enough in the volly service.  All I had to do was support until I was comfy.  Well....I 'supported' a first aid and CPR course already.  Meaning I took a group of the class and taught them how to do CPR and first aid.  *shrugs*  It'll be nice.  It'll be a refresh on my CPR, which I needed to do anyway.  And then I can help with Pre-Basic at Level.

Hmm.  Thought.  Maybe we should put first aid on the prebasic list.  A bunch of the probies aren't interested in taking a medical first.  Actually, hardly any are.  It'll give them an idea on what to do until they get first responder or EMTB.  Maybe I'll talk to Craig about that.  I don't really remember what kind of medical stuff, other than CPR, was required for prebasic.

Alright....so enough complaints and babbles.  I"m going to bed...if I can sleep.  I might....oh nevermind, you don't want to know anyway.  *devilish grin*

Well, maybe not completely my way, but I can't complain. I'm done with HtH, end of story. Will never advise anyone to work there.....ever. Erm...we had a nasty PI Rescue yesterday afternoon. It made the news, though it was only a five second clip. The BIG mess in Baltimore outside the tunnel was a little bit bigger of a story. It's alright, though. *stomps around growling "Rar Rar Rar" in responce to the PI yesterday* ALright, now that that is out of my system. I'm oh so anxiously awaiting the results to the I test. *please note the sarcasm* After what I saw yesterday, I'm afraid to continue with the medical side of things. I really don't want to be apart of that. And if you haven't picked up with what I'm talking about, I'm going to let it drop. You know the old saying: "No need to air dirty laundry." Alright.....I'm going to go update my journal. I think I have a few PI's to put down. I'll have to check. Update: I never put down the PI Rescue we had on the 4th of the month. How could I have forgotten??? :)

Let me tell you how frustrated I was today at work.  I up and left.  Just said: "I'm done and I'm not coming back today."  What finally set me off?  The dispatcher calls and asks us to come back to the Churchville office so I can move my truck - I was blocking someone in.  Well, she calls us back about 5 minutes later and asks our ETA.  I tell her about 5 minutes.  A moment of silence.  Then: "You don't have to come here anymore.  We've got it moved."  That was the last straw.  I had my driver take me back to the office so they could explain to me what had happened.  It seemed that one of the office workers didn't want to wait for us to get there, so they climbed into my truck, popped it into neutral, and pushed it out of the way(I drive a stick).  That really did it.  I went back, tossed my paperwork into the bin, clocked out, and left.  I am so tired of being told there is a quarter on the floor, bending over to pick it up, then being fucked hard and dry.  And in the end said quarter ends up being non-existant.  Frustrating.  Grr.

Alright.  I'm done.  I need to go home and get some sleep.  :D

I'll do some non-bitching later....hopefully!  ;)

Erg.  I'm still here.  Yay.  *hopes you all catch the sarcasm*

We had fun last night.  A bunch of us went over to one of the guys house and had a nice little bon fire.  It was fun.  And we figured something out.  Guys get depressed when they drink, girls drink because they're depressed.  *grins*  I really don't know why we came to this conclusion, but we did.

Rico was sent to Harford yesterday for dog bites.  He owns about 4 pitbulls.  Well, two of them started 'argueing'.  Rico and his mother decided to stop them and consiquently ended up being bitten themselves.  I don't know about Rico's mother, but Rico was pretty messed up.  He ended up with about 4 stitches in his knee.  The bite went into his muscle, along with some air bubbles, so it's going to hurt for awhile.  And I think he had various butterfly bandages on his wrist from bites there as well.  Needless to say he's going to be out for a bit.  But we're just thankful that he's alright.  :)

So Justy's birthday was on wednesday.  He gave me this lovely list of things he wants.  Varies from "fake dog poo poo" to "F-14".  Isn't that grand!  *laughs*  He does have a few things on there that are actually buyable.  Well...the "fake dog poo poo" is buyable, but I don't know if my parents would appreciate it.  :D  

And moms birthday is tomorrow.  She has this list as well, but I have yet to see it.  Tony has it now.  Says he's going to get one thing on it, give it to my sister, she's going to get one thing on it, and then give it to me....and so on.  But we also have to take into acount mothers day on the 9th.  So it's going to be a spending frenzy here soon.

So I've quit HtH.  I think I said that before.  But the grand thing is I already have another job.  My last day at HtH is next wednesday and my first day of the other job is the following monday.  So all is well.  :)  Though, it is going to be a bit of a pay cut.  But then again, it's going to be hard finding part time work that pays what I was getting at HtH.  *shrugs*  I guess that's why it's called temporary.  :D

So I've put my name on the list for Baltimore City, I'm taking a test for Baltimore County, I'm putting in an application for AA County, and I might put one in for Fairfax.  I have to think about that one.  Hopefully one of them will come through.  *crosses fingers*  Alright.  So I'm going to take this oppurtunity to go now.  All is updated and blah blah blah.

I'M SO BORED!!! I wanna go do something, but there is nothing to do.  Blah.  Rob is on though.....*grins*....haven't talked to him in awhile.  He's a little drunk....but who around here isn't....*another grin*....seems to be the all-to-present state of most people's beings as of late.  *giggles*  I'm gonna get going now.  Gonna find something to get into.





:D



Oh yeah....J-MAN TURNED 10 TODAY!  Yay for birthdays!  *does a birthday dance*

Oh. God. I am so sore. We had our practical session to our FF Survival and Rescue course. It doesn't really sound like it was much, but when you're doing it....Oh. God. FF Survival and Rescue, Practical Day 1 That's basically what we did in a nutshell. I left out the part about me dropping my helmet about 6,000 times. *impish grin* But it's alright. I didn't break anything. So all is well. :) I'm just really sore. And not looking forward to doing this again first thing tomorrow morning.....knowing I'm still going to be sore. :D So nothing else much is going on. The MCI drill tomorrow is quickly going to hell in a handbasket. There were initially about 10 people signed up....some with rescue training. Now only about 2 or 3 are goig to go....maybe one might have rescue training. But that still doesn't qualify someone as being experienced, you know? I'm thinking it might be a good idea to go to bed here soon. Yeah....bed....

Right....so I'm done with HtH.  I was pissed but willing to work up until they accused me of doing things I didn't do.  And then wouldn't listen to my side of the story.  I don't deal with that very well.  So I put my two weeks notice in.  Lemme' 'splain.

I already explained about my calling out sick on saturday.  Well, one of the higher ups wishes to talk with me.  So I go in, also wanting to get my check.  He says, I have a few things we need to talk about. 

One is your being late.  I was in an accident and called the dispatcher to tell her, but that didn't matter.  I was late so it had to be written up.  That's 1.  

What happened on saturday.  That's 2.  

This next little part just kills me.  He accused me of falling asleep on a patient....a psychiatric patient.  Right.  I don't know who 'complained', but it was written in his report that I was sleeping in the back of the unit with a psych pt and their family on board.  Here's what it was.  I sit in the captains chair.  I lean my head against the wall and write my reports.  That's how I sit, that's how I've always sat.  Especially when my pt is sleeping.  You can ask any of my old partners.  But apparently someone thought I was sleeping and wrote it up.  HtH wasn't interested in hearing my side.  I was being accused and therefore was guilty.  That's 3.  

And the last little bit that finally did it.  He pulled out a report that stated that I left the unit in complete disarray.  That always pisses me off when I come into work and find the unit dirty.  Well, one morning I came in and found potatoe chips, paperwork, garbage, 4x4's, alcohol preps, and dirty linen all over the place.  There were pen marks on the ceiling and seats, there were flower petals all over the floor....I mean, you name it it was there.  Down to there being blood on the floor.  I was livid that morning.  But, just like anyother time, if I were to have said something nothing would have been done.  So I just wrote everything down on the back of my preshift check sheet and put it in the box.  Well, one of our ALS providers called in however, and complained.  Well....when they looked back they saw that I was the last one in the unit when the ALS provider made the complaint and assumed it was me.  The higher up I was talking to didn't believe me until I began describing everything on his sheet w/o having seen the paper yet.  That's 4.

I don't do very well when I'm accused of doing things that I don't do, and then don't even get a chance to have the situation investigated.  So I'm quitting.  I really don't care where I go, just so long as the higher up's treat their employees like people, not shit.  I got suspended for a shift over the whole sleeping thing.  I'm very angry with them.  And like I said, because I am the accused I must be guilty.  *sighs*

Other than that everything is going well.  I finally got my Rescue Tech. card in the mail.  Yay!  So now it's all official and everything.  Yay!

I really hate my job.  *grins*  I am so tired.  Yesterday was probably one of the worst days I've had.  

My second day in I was ill and didn't come to work.  I wasn't going to go to class either, but mom reminded me that if I felt ill I could just run into the bathroom.  So I went to the class.  Knowing full well that one of the dispatchers for HtH was also in class, so it's not like I was trying to ditch work and 'pull a fast one'.  Anyway, back to the point.  Last night.

I get to work and the Major is there.  He's babbling about how my driver and I are going to do two cath calls in the morning with him.  Alright....so he's putting the narcs on our unit and 'preparing' it for the morning.  I do a pre shift check and he starts yelling at me because I didn't check something that I don't need to check.  Long story.  But he and I got into it.  So I went in and went to bed.  I was tired and I still don't feel very well.  My supervisor comes in about 5 minutes later and explains that "Company policy is that we can't sleep before 11".  So I get back up and go sit on the couch.  He then proceeds to try to make me feel like I've been caught doing something bad.

Super: "Where were you yesterday?"
Me: "I was sick."
Super: "Sick huh?"
Me: "Yeah...."
Super: "Well, next time your sick, don't get caught at your class."

I just looked at him.  He started to leave, but I cut him off.

Me: "I'm not dumb.  I know Jen was in that class.  If I was really trying to ditch work when I wasn't sick, I wouldn't have gone to class either.  And I really don't appreciate your insinuation that I'm stupid."

He really didn't say much after that.  He just left.  So the Major comes back and says that we're not doing those cath calls but are going to be in a different unit for the evening and that in the morning we'd be going to churchville to stage while the other crews are out.  Alright, that's fine and dandy too.  So I do another preshift check and we discover that the unit has half a tank of fuel.  So at 2200 we go get fuel.  Get back at about 2230.  We sit until 2300 and I'm about to go to bed when we get a call.  Harfrod to Sheppard Pratt.  "*sigh*"  So we up and do this call, and on our way back we get dispatched another Harford to Sheppard Pratt.  On our way back to Harford, our dispatcher calls and tells us to go to Union instead.  So we get to Union just as we get our info.  It's a Union to Sheppard Pratt.  "*sighs again*"  We get done with this call and it's not about 0500.  Dispatch sends us to Churchville to stage.  Then says we need to go to the Towson office to pick up the Major because he dropped off an ambo there and needed a ride home.  So we're on our way there when the ALS crew calls and says they'd go get him.  So we get sent back to HdG.  We get there about 0600 and go to bed.  At about 0645 dispatch calls and wants us to pick the Major up from Churchville to take him back to HdG to get his car.  We muddle around and finally go out to the unit.  Just as we're getting in and about to go, the Major comes out and asks where we were going.  So we climb out of the unit and go back to sleep.  Then, at about 0715, dispatch calls and asks where we were and if we were en route to Churchville yet.  So we have to explain all that.  Then we go back to sleep.  And finally, at 0745, the Major wants me up to clean my unit before we leave.

I was very upset.  Let's just say that when I got home and went to sleep, I didn't get up until 0700 this evening.  Just enough time to wake up and go back to work.  yay.

ALright....bitch session over.  I might write something else on here later.  G'night....

You know what I love?  I love those pieces of popcorn that are half popcorn half kernel.  Especially when they're slightly burned.  Mmmmmmmmm.........

I also love my Bin.  She is the most beautiful thing I've ever seen.  Mom says I don't spend enough time with her....but she doesn't know how much time I *actually* spend with her.  I wake up early, with her laying next to me and we'll just lay there.  I'll rub her, she'll purr.  And we'll do that for hours until I have to get up.  And she's spoiled rotten!  God is she spoiled.  I'll give her milk in a saucer whenever she wants....likewise with the tuna.  And it normally works that way with going out, so long as the weather is nice.

I love her.  :D

And milk.  I absolutely adore milk.  Yum!






I really don't know what spawned that.  But it makes me feel slightly better having said it.  

I have a feeling I'm going to lose my job tomorrow.  I'm going to call out.  I'm taking this BTLS class and I got absolutely no help from my higher-ups at work to find replacements.  I mean, I need this class to keep my certification, to keep my job.  Well....I take the class and I lose the job.  *shrugs*  Whatever happens, happens I suppose.

M'tired.....so m'gonna lay down....g'night....

*giggles* I just took this test and I thought the results were kinda funny.
Your Energy is Red. You are strong in character and
love to be active and competitive. Driven and
goal oriented, you know what you want and what
it takes to get it. Courageous, strong, and
fair, you like to see equal justice for all.
You prefer the material world and all things
tangible. You would make an ideal surgeon, emergency medical
technician, weight lifter, athlete, chiropractor,
or pioneer in some field.

What color is your energy?

Tell me if you understand this(and you'd have to know Maryland/Harford County to fully understand)....There are two ALS crews on duty, both sitting in Churchville, and one BLS crew sitting in HdG.  At nights, the HdG crew get's sent to Towson to sit....but is still responsible to run all the BLS calls they would get that night.  Most BLS calls that come in are generally in Bel Air or Elkton.  Does this make sense to you?  Make the only BLS crew on duty to sit at least 45 minutes away from the majority of the calls?  I mean, we haven't had *ANY* BLS calls in Towson since that office opened, yet they want the only BLS crew to sit up there.  Meanwhile, the ALS crews sit all night until an ALS call comes in, which doesn't happen very often.  The majority of the ALS calls are usualy in by the beginning of shift and are scheduled for the mornings.  It doesn't make any sense.  *shakes head*

That's all I have to say about that.  

I think I still have that bottle of rum downstairs....I could still probably put it to good use.  






Actually....I just might.

I really feel used.....and dumb.  And it's probably because I'm a lot bit of both right now.  *sighs*

Nuthin' much is happening in the wonderful world of Level right now.  Well, except maybe that David is trying to get BUddy's car to kiss his.  But that's just funny.

Yet again I come to this place where I don't want to go home, but I don't want to stay here.  I don't know if I have the money to go driving around....and it too rainy to stay in one place for too long.  I might just go down and sit at the park for awhile anyway.  Even though I'm not supposed to....I'll just pretend like I didn't know or something.  *sighs again*

Dumb and used, that's all I am.

Hmmm....what to put in here.  Oh, I know.  Tony got a tatoo.  It's a chinese fish looking creature and it's right below his belly button.  It's really cute.  He was showing me before he went to work this afternoon.  He got it in New Orleans.  He went down with Kelly and Eric to visit/take care of a few things last week.  It's(his tatoo) really cool looking.

Rescue Tech....well, I failed the initial test.  BUT....I'm not the only one.  9 passed, 8 failed.  That typically says something about the instructor.  *shrugs*  Oh well.....we have to take the re-test at some point in time here soon, so I figure I'm just going to call Tracy tomorrow and schedule the make up test.  And if I fail twice then oh well.  It never hurts to take a class more than once.

Binx.  I love her.

I finally figured out Jaina's schedule.  She sent me an email with her class schedule and it was in ebonics.  :-D  Or I guess it was more of college lingo....but I figured it out, and let me tell you it took awhile.  She sent it to me when the semester began and now there are only about 4 more weeks before semester exams begin.  *laughs*

The firehouse is still turning.  Things have quieted down a bit.  Hawkeye tried to get the company to over ride the boards decision, but that didn't go over very well.  And unfortunately, Donny didn't get into 2, 5, or 5-9 because of what happened up here.  You know, looking back, if I had known that this was going to happen, I wouldn't have written him up in the first place.  Though, I don't really think it would have mattered anyway.  Yeah, he was becoming a bothersome Lt., but he was still a provider for the ambulance.  Whether or not he was good or bad I can't really say because I never rode with him, but I've mostly only heard good things.  There was occasions, but not enough to say we're probably better off.  I just think he was having a major power trip/having a hard time equalizing power over friendship.  I don't know if that made sense to you guys, but it did to me.  

I dunno'....I've just been thinking a lot about him lately.  Mostly since Danny and I talked the other night.  I mean, we didn't talk about any one thing in particular.  I just let him vent a bit.  He's got some valid points, and he's in a really rough spot, but I think he needs to stand up and make a stand to someone.  I'm not too sure who that someone is because I'm not Dan and I don't know what he truely believes( I can make a good guess based on how he acts/what he says).....but it needs to be done.  He's being pulled in so many different directions and he's keeping his mouth shut about everything.  Some things should be said, though.

Oh well.  *cough cough*  Oh ick!  I wish I could cough this shit up and have it just be done with!  *grumbles*

I think I'm gonna go now.  Rest, or something along those lines.  :D

Happy Easter.  Today went well.  J-Man got a big basket of stuff, which he loves.  There is tons of candy.  Tons of food from dinner.  And a good time was had by all.

Though, I didn't get a rabbit this year.  I got white chocolate peanut butter cups....but I think that's cause I don't like regular chocolate.  :D

*smells banana*  J-man is eating a banana and regailing me with many stories of the day....even though I was here.  *grins*

And he got this neat airplane thing.  It's wood and it flies really well.  It's cool.

ALright....I think I'm gonna go.  Happy holidays to everyone.

Alright....so I wake up this afternoon at about noon-30 and come to the firehouse.  It is here that I realize that I was supposed to go on a house burning today.  And I forgot all about it.  Evan got burned.  He's going to be about for possibly 5 days, maybe not quite as long.  I'm not too sure.  Also, a couple of other members of 2 got burned today as well.  Thankfully, though, only 2 people ended up in the ER.  *shakes head*  Something wrong definately happened today....

Is there anything else to talk about on here?  No, I don't think there is.  Except that we've been having nice weather lately.  Though it's probably going to start raining here soon because I said that.  *shrugs*  Oh well....April showers bring May flowers.

Justin did *not* take his medicine this morning and it really shows.  

Next topic.... :)  I love the Bin.  She is beautiful.

Hm.  Now what.  Ah, I have to find replacements for those days I'm taking class.  Still.  *shrugs*  Oh well.

I LOVE BINX!

Kathy thought I would be going late in Jury duty today so she gave me a replacement.....big misunderstanding.  However, this means I'm out another day's pay.  Grr.  Oh well.....nuthin' I can do now.  I am working tomorrow night.  Thankfully.  

Argh.  I don't want to be sitting home on a friday night.  And that would be my fault.  I should have gone with the guys to the track.  Yet again, another oh well.  I guess I'm just sitting here feeling sorry for myself.  *sigh*

ARGH!

I was reading through one of my old journals.  Boy have I changed.  I don't even know where to begin when it comes to differences.  I know these things happen, but to read and realize just how much it has happened is kinda neat.  Almost scary.  It's amazing how simple events can change a whole perspective on something.  One years worth of maturity, or whatever you would call it.  My world went from being a seed, to growing into an oak, and it was so obvious to me when I read that I, too, was still a child at one point.  Yeah, I still have my moments, or try to anyway.  I dunno'....it's just weird.

I gotta go....

Well....I went to the doctors.  He says I have a touch of Bronchytis....which means I did *not* catch it from my patient and this makes me feel much better.

Though, the bon fire helped too.  :D

However, I am *very* tired right now so this is going to be short and to the point.

I'm thinking about quitting HtH.  Not only is it an inconvience to them and myself when we can't find coverage for the days I have class....but they are now enforcing the policy that they will not find coverage for any employee unless it's an emergency.  Oh....one more thing.  Well, person.  And I leave it at that.

New topic:  I was selected for Jury duty.  And of course I get placed on the damn panel.  The States attorney says: "No, ,I am not content.  I want so and so taken off the panel.  I respectfully request the next two people to be dismissed.  I want her to be on the panel."   Well....not quite like that, but you get the point.  I honestly feel that the States attorney feels that because I'm a firefighter, I'm going to lean towards what the cops say.  And that's why he wanted me on the panel.  ANyway.  The point is....I'm now on a panel of 12(+3 alternates) for a trial that'll last until monday,  at least.  I'm losing two 12 hour days of pay for $20 a day replacement funds.  My recent paycheck is not enough to cover my car insurance(thank god I saved up some), and I really need the money.  Of course....I get to be a Juror.  I'm Ray.  These things happen to Ray.

*rolls eyes*  I'm very tired.  I'll talk about the bon fire later.  G'night.

Well, I've seemed to create quite a stir again. :-D I suppose that's what I do best these days. *shrugs* Oh well....I've said what I need to say, anything else is up in the air. I've come down with something quite nasty. And when I say nasty, I mean *NASTY*. I think I got it from one of my patients. We were dispatched to a chest pains and she also had this nasty cough/chest tightness. Well, my main concern was the 8/10 chest pain, so I put her on 15L O2 NRB and gave her another nitro(yes, I asked all the appropriate questions and took all vitals and the blah blah). Well....I couldn't have given her one of those surgical masks or Heppa masks or whichever we have to give because she was on the O2. But I still feel like a twit. I know there was no way to put a mask on her....*shakes head*....but I wish there was some way to have avoided this torture. *groans* Having just taken all my vitals, here's my patient assessment on myself: BP: 152/78 P: 147 O2: 94% R: *erp, skipped this one* Temp: 100.6 (and my core temp is 97.6) S - Productive cough Tightened chest Throbbing head Vomitting x7 since 04-04-04 AM Rib pain Weakness Tiredness A - Latex PCN E-Micin Betadine M - None prescribed, however using an Albuterol Inhaler and Motrin P - None L - Pizza 04-04-04 PM E - Having taken a patient to the ER presenting with similar symptoms That was actually kinda fun. I should fill out a MAIS for myself. Teehee! Alright, well I'm going to go. Someone just took something out of the bay and I'm going to go see what....

Now just so you know, I'm not posting this as a "Catholic is the way to go" type of post. I just thought this was interesting. Allah or Jesus? By Rick Mattes Last month I attended my annual training session that's required for maintaining my state prison security clearance. During the training session there was a presentation by three speakers representing the Roman Catholic, Protestant, and Muslim faiths, who explained each of their belief systems. I was particularly interested in what the Islamic Imam had to say. The Imam gave a great presentation of the basics of Islam, complete with a video. After the presentations, time was provided for questions and answers. When it was my turn, I directed my question to the Imam and asked: "Please, correct me if I'm wrong, but I understand that most Imams and clerics of Islam have declared a holy jihad [Holy war] against the infidels of the world. And, that by killing an infidel, which is a command to all Muslims, they are assured of a place in heaven. If that's the case, can you give me the definition of an infidel?" There was no disagreement with my statements and, without hesitation, he replied, "Non-believers!" I responded, "So, let me make sure I have this straight. All followers of Allah have been commanded to kill everyone who is not of your faith so they can go to Heaven. Is that correct?" The expression on his face changed from one of authority and command to that of a little boy who had just gotten caught with his hand in the cookie jar. He sheepishly replied, "Yes." I then stated, "Well, sir, I have a real problem trying to imagine Pope John Paul commanding all Catholics to kill those of your faith or Dr. Stanley ordering Protestants to do the same in order to go to Heaven!" The Imam was speechless. I continued, "I also have a problem with being your friend when you and your brother clerics are telling your followers to kill me. Let me ask you a question. Would you rather have your Allah who tells you to kill me in order to go to Heaven, or my Jesus who tells me to love you because I am going to Heaven and He wants you to be there, too?" You could have heard a pin drop as the Imam hung his head in shame. Needless to say, the organizers and/or promoters of the 'Diversification' training seminar were not happy with Rick's way of dealing with the Islamic Imam and exposing the truth about the Muslim's beliefs. I think everyone in the U.S. should be required to read this, but with the liberal justice system, liberal media, and the ACLU, there is no way this will be widely publicized. Please pass this on to all your e-mail contacts. This is a true story and the author, Rick Mattes, is a well-known leader in prison ministry. Side note: I would just like you all to know that I am not a religion basher. I did not post that to create harsh feelings. I, as I've mentioned at other times, just felt that someone who claimed to have such a position in the Muslim religion would say such things. I myself believe that anyone can believe anything they wish. As an ignorant person to the ways of the Muslim religion, I post an apology to any I may have offended. I did not intend this to be as crude as it may have seemed....

Well, I cleaned the shit outta 112 today.  It looks nice and shiny, but it probably won't stay that way.  *shrugs*  It'll give me something to do later when it gets dirty.  

I also cleaned the shit outta the radio room.  It's amazing what you find when you clean an area that hasn't been really cleaned in a very long time.  It took me about an hour.  The room is not that big.  I also found these quotes, and one is really neat.

"Life is not measured by the breaths we take, but by the moments that take our breath."

I like that.  It's very true.  It's one of those things that you know, you just never think about.

Tomorrow is the breakfast.  Alice asked me to be up here at the crack of dawn, which means I should probably go home and get some sleep, since we loose an hour tonight.  But I'm just not tired.  I don't want to go home either.  I *REALLY* don't want to sit up here by myself all night, but it looks like I have no choice.  I *could* go down to HdG and see if anyone's at the Hose Company....I might do that anyway.  I dunno' yet.

*sigh*  I wish Jaina were here.  She's make things all better.  But nOo....she had to go to college.  :)  

My finger looks really bad.  Dan and I went into the back to help Alice, Dave, and Alex set up for breakfast tomorrow and now it's back to being as swollen as it was in the first place.  If it's not better by tomorrow night(and by better I mean looking better, not completely better), I guess I'm going to have to make an appointment to go up to Kirk to get it looked at.  Fortunately, the knuckles not as sore anymore.  That's always a plus.

So mom and J-man are spending another night down....erm, up....at Susans.  Dad is up in Pittsburg for the weekend.  Tony's in, uhm....I can't remember, but he's there and it's not here.  So it was just me and Anth this weekend.  It was a nice change from the ordinary.

Alright, I think I'm going to go find something else to do.  I might be back on here later.

How can you see into my eyes like open doors?
Leading you down into my core,
Where i've become so numb without a soul my spirit sleeping somewhere cold,
Until you find it there and lead it back home wake me up inside.
Wake me up inside,
Call my name and save me from the dark.
Bid my blood to run,
Before i come undone.
Save me from the nothing i've become.

Now that i know what i'm without,
You can't just leave me.
Breathe into me and make me real,
Bring me to life.

Wake me up inside,
Wake me up inside,
Call my name and save me from the dark.
Bid my blood to run,
Before i come undone.
Save me from the nothing i've become.
Bring me to life.

Frozen inside without your touch without your love,
Darling only you are the life among the dead.

All this time i can't believe i couldn't see,
Kept in the dark but you were there in front of me.
I've been sleeping a thousand years it seems,
Got to open my eyes to everything.

Without a thought without a voice without a soul,
Don't let me die here.
There must be something more.

Bring me to life.

Wake me up inside,
Wake me up inside,
Call my name and save me from the dark.
Bid my blood to run,
Before i come undone.
Save me from the nothing i've become.
Bring me to life.

Bring me to life.

Well....I struck again.  Literally.  I nearly broke my left hand pointer the other day in class.  Trying to pry into a car door with a pry-bar and an 8-lb maul, my finger slipped and I smashed it between the two.  I didn't even have enough time to give Evan the maul and take off my glove before it had started swelling and bruising.  Everyone thought it was broken....except Steve and I.  And maybe Colby.  Steve palpated it, and while he was doing so I yanked on Colby's sleeve because I didn't want to yell.  It hurt like a bitch!  But all is well.  I only damaged the muscle enough to keep me incapacitated for a few days.  The doctor has it splinted and wishes me not to use it.  It's kinda weird.  He wrote me a note to stay out of work until the 4th, and another one for the firehouse to stay inactive for 2 to 3 days since the 30th.  It's weird.  But Kathy was not too pleased about it at all.

While I'm sitting in the ER, my shift supervisor and his partner stoll by to pick up a patient.  Of course, they stop in to see what's going on....why I was there.  I explained to him what happened and he went on his merry way.  Well, not more than 45 minutes later my phone starts to ring.  It's HtH.  Kathy was calling to ask me about my finding a replacement for work for the next day(I had class and therefore was out both my day shifts).  I explained to her that I hadn't been able to find one, hence the reason I had gone to her 3 days prior to ask for her help.  She says:  "You have to come into work tomorrow."  Well, that's all fine and dandy, but the doctor doesn't want me to work.  So I explained this to her, and she comes back with: "I find it interesting that <insert name here> broke his finger and all he did was tape it up.  And he came back to work the next day."  Well, this little trip of mine to the ER is being covered by the Harford County Government and I'm not about to do something to piss them off and keep them from paying.  I told her that I was going to bring her the doctors note as soon as soon as I got out, which I did, and she said that she was sorry it had to be this way.  Which I don't quite understand.  Well....I have a theory, but I'm not about to go abouts putting it on here.  It has proven to be a bad thing to put one's opinion on here....*glances towards a certain young lady*....but that's neither here nor there.

Anyroad....I ended up being the referee for my parents again.  I'm going to leave this at that.  Let's just say I ended up at Evan's house.  Oh....and with a funny story to go along with it.  :D

I'm up at the firehouse, just got there, and David comes strolling out.  He asked me if we had any tools on the engine to get something out of a toilet.  Of course, my first question was "What did you drop and how far did it go?"  His belt buckle fell off and landed in the urinal and he didn't want to reach into there to pull it out(I don't blame him....).  So I told him to double glove and just pull it out that way.  Well, he's not quite used to taking medical gloves off yet and when he pulled, he still ended up getting urinal water on him.  :)  So he washed his hands and headed over to his house so he could change his pants.  Well, while I'm waiting for him to get changed, I roll down the window in his truck to call the cat.  He comes back out and I go to put the window up, but it won't go.  He then tells me that the window won't *go* up.  So we have to take his door apart to get the window up.  Well, before we did that, I told him to go grab a pair of plyers....(the glass was *RIGHT* there, we just couldn't get a good grip on it)....and before I could explain to him to buffer the metal-to-glass contact with a glove or towel or something, he grabs the window and starts to yank.  Well, as I'm sure you guessed, it didn't work too well.  He, fortunately for him, chipped the glass.  He's lucky he didn't break it completely.  Anyway, so he tried it again and chipped it again.  *THEN* he grabbed a glove and tried.  Well, that didn't work so we took the door compeltely apart.  In the process, it was locked.  Well....so was the drivers side door.  None of us realized that until I went to put my jacket in his truck and couldn't get in.  So Dave yanked open the back window and climbed through....I could have sworn he was gumby!  :D  It was *very* funny.

But for now I'm going to go.....

The past few days have been....Good grief.  I think that explains it in a nutshell.  Spent friday night down at House 2 in HdG with Craig, Drew, Evan, Matt, and Kristin.  We tried to go to Coakleys, but I could't quite get in.  It was rather amusing.  I looked at Craig and told him that I wasn't going to get in because I looked 12.  He thought otherwise.  Out of three underage, I was the only one who didn't get in.  :D

Then last night I spend the night out at 2 with Craig, Evan and mom.  It was fun all-in-all.  Didn't go home until about 6ish.  Didn't wake up today until about 4ish.  Went to bowling all light-headed and kinda loose feeling.  *wide ass grin*  And amazingly, I bowled all three over my average.  135, 152, and 121.  Yes, I know.  I'm a terrible bowler....but I still bowled well for me.  :D

At the end of bowling, we got a firecall, so I hauled ass down here.  This is where I sit.  Thinkin' about going home.  Maybe not.  I dunno'.  I'm not tired, but I have nothing to do.  Eric wants me to come over to "play xbox with him".  I don't think so.  I know what he wants and I'm not going to give it to him.  I'm not some dollar store whore.  Hey, that rhymes.

Alright, so I'm going to go now.  I'll babble more at you later.  Night.

Well, I should probably be in bed right now....but I'm conducting an experiment. So when I'm done with this I'll go. Now, let me recap the past few nights and then today. Two nights ago: I work at the HdG office. We run our asses off. We get very little(as in 1 hour) sleep. Yes, tired. When I finally did get off work, I had things to do(ie pick up check, pay bills, and there was something else, but I don't remember)....so I didn't get a really good nap. Last night: I worked at the HdG office again and got a little more sleep(about 2 to 3 hours). Right after work, I had to go to Towson to drop off my application for Baltimore County. I dunno' if I'll even be looked at, but at least I tried. Oh, side story. It was kinda comical. As Rachel and I are going through Bel Air, we come to the red light next to the mall at Rt. 24 and the mall near the McDonalds. Across the road, stopped at the red light, and in the turn lane, is a SUV with someone standing with the drivers side door open, talking ot the driver. Well, the light turns green for the turn people, and the person talking moves to the back of the SUV and starts to push....all the way through the light and into the McDonalds parking lot. It was funny looking.... Anyroad....now that I'm done being distracted....*mind wanders a moment*.... 113 IS BACK! You have no idea how much this pleases me. It totally makes up for the lousy two nights of work I had. We spent two hours restocking it and it's now in service. I'm am SO VERY PLEASED! *wide ass grin* It was funny....while we were restocking, Evan was taking a 50 foot section of 3 inch to the front bumper. Matt saw him and here's what happened: Matt: Hey Evan, now you know what I feel like everyday.... Evan: Yeah, 50 feet of hose and it never gets used! Teehee! After we made sure everything was where it was supposed to be, I went home to clean up and go with mom to dinner. I had eaten pizza, but she was hungry, so I went with her anyway. *makes a face* I digress....anyroad, we get done with dinner and decide to see if Craig is up at House 2. Of course, he is. He, Chad + Tommy(and their respective others), Jimmie from Abingdon, and Kristin from Joppa are up there talking in front of 512. So we stop in and I end up staying the majority of the night there....just chit-chatting with Craig and the gang. Eventually, everyone filtered through and it ended up being a bunch of Level guys hanging out in front of 512 blaring country music. If Bobby were in town....*grins*.... Well, as we were leaving we see these three guys smashing the hell out of this little white car. It was very odd. Well, Craig started yelling toward us while he shut the bay doors and made sure everything was all cleaned up. The dudes thought he was yelling at them and got ignorant with us. It ended up resulting in us leaving and calling the police. I'm not too sure what happened, but when I went back to House 2 to retrieve my pager(which was left on the bench), the boys *and* the car were gone. *shrugs* Just so long as they leave me alone and don't hurt anyone in the process.... Alright....well, my little experiment worked, so now I'm going to bed. I'll babble more at you later......when I'm not half asleep. ;)

I'm very pleased with Joes idea.  It turned out really well.  We made about $740ish dollars between pit beef and donations.  We even had one guy donate $40.  We were very pleased.  Actually, so pleased we're going to have another one in the not too distant future.  Maybe figure out if we can do one once a month in the summer....now mind you this is all still in the planning stages, but I think it could really work out.  Obviously we won't make the same amount every time, and the donations are not going to be quite as high....but it could still work.

:D

Very pleased indeed.
